org.as2lib.ant
Class UnitTest

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.as2lib.ant.UnitTest

public class UnitTest
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task

UnitTest executes a unit test swf and writes the result to the console.

The unit test swf must send the result over the XML socket, with host "localhost" and port 3212 by default or the one declared in the build file.

If As2lib Unit Test is used the unit test swf may register the XmlSocketTestListener at the test runner which sends the test execution information properly formatted to this task.

If AsUnit is used the unit test swf may register the XmlSocketResultPrinter at the test runner which sends the test execution information properly formatted to this task.

XmlSocketTestListener and XmlSocketResultPrinter can be found in the "flash" directory of the as2ant distribution.

The sent test execution information must be formatted as follows:

  • <start>Start message.</start>
  • <update>Update message.</update>
  • <pause>Pause message.</pause>
  • <resume>Resume message.</resume>
  • <error>Error message.</error>
  • <failure>Failure message.</failure>
  • <finish hasErrors="false/true">Finish message.</finish>
  • <message>Arbitrary message.</message>

As soon as the ant task receives the finish information it will close the opened unit test swf and finish its execution.

This task can take the following arguments:

  • swf (test swf file to execute and receive unit test results from)
  • flashplayer (location of the flashplayer to execute the swf with)
  • port (port of the xml socket to listen to)

You must supply 'swf'. Windows users must also supply 'flashplayer'.

Author:
Simon Wacker, Christophe Herreman, Chris Allen
